newsitem.title: USA: NYC Mayor wants agency cuts of $660 mln in FY '98.
newsitem.headline: NYC Mayor wants agency cuts of $660 mln in FY '98.

text.p: New York City Mayor Rudolph Giuliani said he proposes to close a projected fiscal 1998 budget gap by asking city agencies to cut about $660 million, about $100 million more than first planned, according to budget documents.
The mayor plans to unveil his proposed fiscal year 1998 budget at City Hall Thursday morning.
The mayor's new $33.5 billion proposed executive budget also calls for $75 million of asset sales and $294 million of state aid.
The budget calls for slashing to $128 million how much Albany's cutbacks in entitlement programs will save the city.
City sources, who declined to be named, have said the city first had planned on saving $415 million in this area.
